# miniRSA
In this challenge we were give n,e and c of a RSA encryption. We were suppoed to decrypt this message to get the flag. We were also given a wikepedia page on this cipher. 
It seemed almost impossible to do this manually, so I searched for online decryptor. Almost all of them said the ciphered text was too long. But then I found a github page which
had the tools required to decipher the chipher here is the link:- https://github.com/Heisenberk/rsa-ctf-tool/tree/master.

Using their prebuilt libraries:
```Python
from Crypto.Util.number import long_to_bytes
from gmpy2 import iroot


e=3

c=2205316413931134031074603746928247799030155221252519872650073010782049179856976080512716237308882294226369300412719995904064931819531456392957957122459640736424089744772221933500860936331459280832211445548332429338572369823704784625368933 

for i in range(10_000):
    c_try = c + i*N
    m = int(iroot(c_try,3)[0])
    flag = long_to_bytes(m)
    if b'pico' in flag:
        print(flag)
```
After savig this file I ran it on command prompt to get this:-

![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/e88ad85d-3879-4bac-a2b6-ecd759727518)

## The flag for this challenge is:- picoCTF{n33d_a_lArg3r_e_ccaa7776}
